text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.
CORN SALE - Taiwan's Members Feed Industry Group on Thursday bought a 54,000-tonne shipment of U.S. No.2 corn from Tradi Grain at tender for July shipment, traders said.

WHEAT AND BARLEY SALE - Japan's Food Agency said Thursday it bought 60,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 30,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat and 20,000 tonnes of Australian wheat at its weekly tender. The agency also bought 25,000 tonnes of U.S. barley and 20,000 tonnes of Australian barley. They are all for July shipment.
CORN TENDER - South Korea seeks 105,000 tonnes of U.S. yellow No.2 corn for July/September shipment.
SOYBEAN TENDER - South Korea's state-run Agricultural and Fishery Marketing Corp will seek 40,000 tonnes of No.1 soybean on May 16. The bids would close on May 15.

SOYMEAL TENDER - El Salvador was retendering for about 8,000 to 10,000 tonnes U.S. soybean meal under the PL-480 export program for June 1-15 and/or July 1-31 and/or August 1-31 delivery. Offers were to submitted no later than May 12 and will be valid until May 13.
RAPESEED MEAL TENDER - South Korea seeks 31,000 tonnes of rapeseed meal, 13,500 tonnes of cottonseed meal and 11,500 tonnes of palm kernel meal on Friday.
FLOUR TENDER - Yemen is tendering for 150,000 tonnes of soft wheat flour for August/October shipment. The flour was expected to come from the EU, U.S., or both.

WHEAT TENDER - South Korea tendered for 8,000 tonnes of U.S. western white/soft white (ordinary), 3,000 tonnes of hard red winter (protein minimum 11.5 percent), and 2,000 tonnes of dark northern spring (protein minimum 14 percent) for July 5- August 5 shipment.
- Philippine firms rejected bids for 35,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for June shipment due to high prices.

WHEAT TENDERS - Sri Lanka seeks 100,000 tonnes HRW wheat in two lots of 50,000 tonnes. Tenders close on May 16. The first shipment was for May 22-June 5 if from the U.S., Canada, Europe or Argentina, and June 10-19 from Australia or Saudi Arabia. The second shipment was for June 16-25 if from U.S., Canada, the Continent or Argentina, and June 30-July 9 from Australia or Saudi Arabia.
BARLEY TENDER - Cyprus tendered for 25,000 tonnes of barley for May/June shipment.

SUNOIL TENDER - The CCC was tendering on May 7 for 3,000 tonnes of U.S. crude sunflower seed oil for export to Mozambique, June 1-20 shipment. CCC also seeks 2,000 tonnes refined U.S. sunflower seed oil for donation under its export program to Bosnia. Offers were due on May 13.

RICE TENDERS - Jordan seeks 15,000 tonnes of medium grain camolina type rice for delivery in June....Jamaica tendered for 3,000 tonnes U.S. rice in bulk under the PL-480 donation program for May 20-June 5 delivery....Costa Rican millers were privately negotiating for 26,500 tonnes of optional origin long grain rough rice, for June 30-July 7 shipment.
MARKET TALK - Indonesia recently bought a handy-sized cargo of optional origin soymeal from South America and is said to be looking for at least 50,000 tonnes more of meal, dealers said Thursday.
